job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):09The Role: Assistant Manager, Money Markets DirectoryGrade 9ALocation: ManillaThe Team: MMD : The Money Market Directories (MMD) team is responsible in data collection and maintenance of a comprehensive web-based information platform tailored specifically for various types of investors and investment managers worldwide. The team creates customer value by providing timely, comprehensive, and accurate data used to help build business relationships; enable and identify new sales opportunities and sources of capital; perform focused prospecting and develop targeted mailing campaigns. MMD can also provide access to information on key decision makers who manage investment capital worldwide.The Impact: This role will involve working with immediate team members and collaborating with other managers of MMD team across locations and functions like Content, Data Management, Care, Product etc.What’s in it for you: This is an opportunity to lead a team consisting of 10-15 individuals and contribute towards achieving the team’s goals. Accountability would also be towards driving the business objectives and be a role model for people and peer group, communicate with passion and enthusiasm, embrace change as a way of working. Additionally, the Team Leader needs to ensure accurate, complete, and timely delivery of the data to both internal and external clients, managing stakeholder relationship & building technical acumen by virtue of involvement in various projects.               Responsibilities: Having a people first mindset, showing empathy, and supporting members in challenging timesMotivating the team, executing career progression discussions and succession planning.Developing technical acumen within group for future growthSetting SMART objectives for team members, preparing, and conducting active performance management. Communicating clearly on Pay for Performance culture and principles and the linkage to Rewards.Monitoring team performance (maintaining & communicating Time Utilization, Quality stats etc.), setting challenging benchmarks and ensuring efficient resource utilizationManaging dynamic work allocation of team members and setting up an efficient R&A matrix.Conducting weekly team meetings to discuss updates, statistics, and other information.Executing short-term to long term projects from resource planning to execution in partnership with Data Management team,Stakeholder management - Driving meaningful conversations with the Leadership team and stakeholders based out of different locations, data management, product etc.Mastering the culture of Innovation through Lean & Automation - Understanding the process and workflow to the extent that ideas are generated around eliminating gaps in content and establishing best practices. Driving a lean mindset & ability to gain operational efficiency.Meeting all critical timelines & requirements on BAU workflows/KPIs & projects, Problem solving at all levels.As people leader be an ambassador of organizational values, culture, and strategy.What We’re Looking For: Must have prior experience in people management.Good problem resolution skills through effective collaboration with various stakeholders.Capacity to give and accept feedback constructively and provide coaching to the team.Exceptional oral and written communication skills.Flexibility to work across various shifts including night shift on rotational or need basis.People management skills, ability to build and motivate a team.Maintains high ethical standards both personally and professionally, to maintain transparency in the team.Proven ability to work with minimal direction, maintain focus while working with routine tasks.Good knowledge of Data/Content Management operations and knowledge of Private Equity/Investment Management universe would be an advantage.The position would require working in rotational/night shifts on need basis.Problem Solving:Solve a variety of problems within their operational setting.Provide solutions based on best practices and existing precedents.Coordinate and manage projects from start to finish.Preferred Qualification:Complete knowledge of SQL and MS tools like Excel, Word, Power PointExpertise in in-house tools, processes and workflow tool like Pathfinder, CTS, Celsus etc.Proficiency in LEAN/AGILE principles, Blue Prism, Python & Six Sigma certification would be an added advantage.Knowledge of Visualization tool like (Tableau, Power BI etc.) is desirableAny previous experience of handling a team of talented individuals.1- 2 years of experience in Quality Vertical/Functions.Green Belt Certification and exposure of Lean Concepts.About S&P Global Market Intelligence

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence.What’s In It For You?Our Purpose:Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
Our People:We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.Our Values:
 Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.

Benefits: We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.

Our benefits include: Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.For more information on benefits by country visit: https://www.spglobal.com/en/careers/our-culture/Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:
At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.

location: Hyderabad, India; Gurgaon, India; Hyderabad, India; Bangalore, India
job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):10The Role: Voice of Customer System Analyst (EMEA)S&P Global’s Enterprise Customer Insights & Analytics team is looking for a data-driven quantitative research administrator and analyst to support our Voice of Customer (VOC) program that ideally has experience working with AI for modeling data and utilizing machine learning models and new analytical methods. This individual will work closely with their team our Senior Manager of CX (Customer Experience) Insights, cross divisional CX stakeholders, and partners to drive meaningful VOC projects and deliver impactful results to the business by uncovering opportunities to enhance the overall customer experience. The Team:We have a dynamic team, accuracy and insights are our hallmarks. Team members eagerly embrace challenges with a curious spirit, always seeking data-driven insights and innovative solutions. Collaboration is woven into our DNA; ideas flow seamlessly, and we celebrate successes not just as individuals but as collective wins.Responsibilities and Impact:Working with Senior CX Insights Manager to administer assigned projects from start to finish; ensuring the success of design, implementation, and delivery of results. This includes collaborating regularly with team, composing surveys; cleaning and preparing resulting data; identifying insights; and presenting findings. Ensure quality control of the enterprise NPS program as it relates to design, technology solutions, vendor management and privacy compliance and uphold the security and confidentiality of documents and data within area of responsibilityMaintain records of all updates in communications for the survey flowProactively work to ensure surveys are deployed on time per the prescribed cadence Partner with subject matter experts to ensure changes or testing within the survey are set up properly and incorporated prior deploymentSpot-check survey responses Develop and distribute consolidated detailed reporting on monthly survey performance. Proactively identify barriers to execution, escalate as needed to ensure resolution and timely survey deployments Train business stakeholders on dashboard best practices (how to login, walking users through how to effectively use the dashboards and data available to them in Qualtrics, etc.) Work with Senior CX Insights Manager to review unstructured data to reveal sentiment, emotion, root cause and translate that to a story using strong analytical thinking and data visualizationAbility to connect databases from various sources and use querying language to manage dataUnderstanding and consideration of any new Qualtrics features and functionality being released and/or available for us to leverage. Hybrid work - you will be asked to come to office 2 days per weekThis role would be EMEA time zone, but we are willing to consider APAC time zone for the right candidateWhat We’re Looking For:Basic Required Qualifications:3+ years working in an analyst role related to CXAdvanced in Microsoft ExcelExperience in any online survey tool - eg. Qualtrics, Survey Monkey, MedaliaAt least good level of English skills - spoken and writtenSelf-starter and interested in technology/SaaS with high technical aptitudeExcellent verbal and written communication skillsOrganized, detail-oriented who can successfully manage tasks, including prioritization and time managementDevelops and maintains positive relationships with internal and external partiesBachelor’s degreeAdditional Preferred Qualifications:Proficient in Qualtrics CX platform with XM certificationProficient in data analysis and visualization tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, R or PythonExperience with utilizing Gen AI tools and platformsData science and/or statistics experienceWhat’s In It For You?Our Purpose:Progress is not a self-starter. Location: Hyderabad, India

About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):07The Role: Data Analyst, Bank RatesThe Team: The FIG-Bank Rates provides depository rates, retail and business fee comparisons for U.S. banks and credit unions for detailed competitive intelligence, including more than 70 standard retail banking products, ranging from deposit products to consumer loan and mortgages.The team ensures accuracy, completeness, and timeliness of data published in the S&P Global Market Intelligence products and solutions. The team has presence in three operating sites – India, Pakistan, and the Philippines – that work collaboratively daily serving financial institutions, academia, regulatory agencies, research firms, and others. As part of a global organization, we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion and value partnership with clients and stakeholders, in constant discovery of innovation and client-value creation and operate with utmost integrity.The Impact:  You will have an opportunity to improve your skillset and grow a global internal and external network that will enable you to regularly assess client service levels and identify creative, viable ways to drive meaningful improvement.What’s in it for you:  Our Company prides itself in being an equal opportunity employer and a result faced meritocracy. We set high standards and value accountability for all. At the same time, we seek to identify and reward exceptional performance with growth opportunities. Based on planned growth and initiatives, you have an opportunity to emerge to more specialized roles and act as a resource for the team.Responsibilities:Perform basic operational requirements with heavy expectations on data accuracy, timeliness, and productivity.Perform research on various sources including calls, website, and documents as per guidelines. You will contact US banks during US business hours primarily via phone calls, supplemented with emails and Internet-based research to collect comprehensive information on the interest rates for their banking products according to SPGMI parametersYou will be responsible for timely entry and submission of data within given timeframesDeveloping and maintaining business relationships with external contacts/clients to actively track information on the covered content set falls under the preview of this job.Deliver on expected productivity and timeliness targets.Deliver accurate, defect-free work, applying 'doing right the first-time' mindset.Identify and report any new disclosure or gaps in policies/procedures.Build subject-matter expertise towards various workflow and processes of the dataset.Contribute towards process improvement through error checks, audit suggestions and tool enhancements.Basic Qualification:Key Competencies:Strong command of the English language both verbal and written. Preferably with prior experience working with international banking institutions, specifically communicating with bank officers with the purpose of data-gathering.Business and financial knowledge, particularly the U.S. banking industry, focusing on its products and services, operations, and structureResearch and analytical skillsInterpersonal skillsExcellent attention to detailTight-knit collaboration skillsQuick learnerResult-oriented mindsetTeam playerBasic MS Office skillsProfessionalism and work ethicsBasic Qualifications:Values partnership with the team and clientsValues discovery through innovation and constant pursuit of excellence; through learning and upskilling; and through value-creation endeavorsValues integrity in handling work and relating with colleagues and clientsExcellent communication skills with great telephonic manner to speak to international clients.The candidate must have a positive attitude towards work and environment/culture of the teamPassionate about work and the urge to go above and beyondAbility to work under tight deadlinesMinimum of Bachelor's/College degreeAn interest in the tech industryAbout S&P Global Market Intelligence

About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):09Senior Sales Executive, Financial Markets (APAC), Mobility DivisionWe are seeking a dynamic Senior Sales Executive for our Mobility Division, focusing on the APAC Financial Markets. Our team delivers automotive sector-focused data solutions to banks, hedge funds and other financial institutions. This role, based in Singapore, is pivotal in driving the expansion of our automotive products and services and achieving revenue growth. The successful candidate will have a strong track record in developing new business, achieving sales targets, and building client relationships.Primary Responsibilities Account PlanningDevelop and implement comprehensive account plans and strategies across products and accounts for the APAC Financial Markets.Contribute actively to the establishment of monthly sales forecasts.Utilize CRM tools to provide an accurate view of territory development and market size, supporting the execution of the sales plan.Consultative SellingDemonstrate a deep understanding of the S&P Global Mobility product portfolio.Engage in significant face-to-face customer interactions.Foster internal collaboration with broader S&P Global divisions to expand synergy.Prepare, communicate, and negotiate pricing and proposals, managing the terms and conditions of the sale.Manage opportunities through the sales pipeline, from qualification to closure.Minimum QualificationsA Bachelor’s degree in sales, marketing, or a business-related field, with at least five years of B2B direct consultative selling experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Strong knowledge and experience in selling into APAC Financial Markets, especially Trading, Securities, and/or Equities.A proven track record in achieving sales targets, acquiring new business, and selling broad-based solutions; proficiency in solution selling techniques.Proven ability to work independently, be a self-starter, and manage day-to-day activities in an unstructured role.Proven negotiation, communication, customer service, and presentation skills.Ability to anticipate and handle difficult customer situations effectively.Intermediate proficiency in SalesForce and Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Other Requirements Frequent international travel to customer sites and/or trade shows.About S&P Global MobilityAt S&P Global Mobility, we provide invaluable insights derived from unmatched automotive data, enabling our customers to anticipate change and make decisions with conviction. Our expertise helps them to optimize their businesses, reach the right consumers, and shape the future of mobility. We open the door to automotive innovation, revealing the buying patterns of today and helping customers plan for the emerging technologies of tomorrow.For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/mobility.What’s In It For You?Our Purpose:Progress is not a self-starter. Job ID: 288237
Posted On: 2024-01-30
Location: Singapore, Singapore

jobtitle: Associate Editor - Market Reporting, Refined Oil
job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):09Job DescriptionThe Role:  The individual in this role is responsible for day-to-day reporting on Asia and Middle East oil markets. He or she is responsible for every aspect of market reporting, including the collection and publication of primary market information, running an assessment process, assessing the value of a variety of markets, reporting market-related news, writing commentary and analysis, contributing to methodology development and engaging with market sources.The Impact:  The editor in this role will be a member of the Platts oil market reporting team based in Singapore. The editor in this role is a member of the team that help maintain Platts’ reputation for providing transparent price assessments by producing market-moving news and analysis.The Career Opportunity:  Platts has a strong global brand and established assessment methodology. You’ll be joining the well-respected oil markets reporting team in Singapore and will gain exposure to multiple refined products and develop a deep understanding of the Asian and Middle East refined oil products markets.Your Skills:  The ideal candidate will have a background in oil market analytics or pricing, have a deep and thorough understanding of Asia and Middle East oil markets, knowledge of trading strategies, an understanding of derivatives markets, written and verbal communication skills, and analysis.Our Hiring Manager says:  “The individual will join the team that produces a number of Platts’ most important benchmark assessments. I’m looking for a driven individual who’s outstanding in news reporting and able to uphold Platts’ standards.”Responsibilities:Gathers oil market information, produces price assessments, writes commentary and market analysisFollows price trends and reports on those trends at end of day or throughout the trading day as necessaryConduct analysis; contribute to content development activities and thought leadership piecesDevelops, expands and maintains sources and contactsQualifications:Minimum of 1-3 years of market reporting or similar analytical role in oil and/or LPG markets.Strong numeric skills with knowledge of crude oil and oil product pricing methodologies.Strong communication skills that demonstrate good listening, clear writing style, and strong verbal skills. The ability to communicate across a wide range of groups and personalities internally and externally.Fluent in English with excellent English writing skills and fluent in Mandarin.Self-driven, energetic and proactiveEntrepreneurial and self-starter mindset with effective problem-solving skills.Ability to work in a team-oriented, global, multi-cultural environment.About S&P Global Commodity Insights
At S&P Global Commodity Insights, our complete view of global energy and commodities markets enables our customers to make decisions with conviction and create long-term, sustainable value.We’re a trusted connector that brings together thought leaders, market participants, governments, and regulators to co-create solutions that lead to progress. Vital to navigating Energy Transition, S&P Global Commodity Insights’ coverage includes oil and gas, power, chemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.S&P Global Commodity Insights is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.

For more information, visit http://www.spglobal.com/commodity-insights.What’s In It For You?Our Purpose:Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. Job ID: 297541
Posted On: 2024-01-30
Location: Penang-Jalan, Pulau Pinang (Penang), Malaysia

jobtitle: Senior Lead Network Engineer (Infoblox DNS, DHCP and IPAM)
location: Hyderabad, India; Bangalore, India; Noida, India
job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):12About the Role: Senior Infoblox DNS, DHCP and IPAM EngineerThe Team: Global Network Services is seeking a senior Infoblox DNS, DHCP and IPAM engineer to join our innovative and dynamic team, where you will play a key role in supporting, designing, implementing, and optimizing systems and services within the DDI sphere.  Our team is characterized by its multi-functional, multi-disciplinary approach, bringing together experts in various network domains to create a collaborative and innovative environment.  We value continuous learning, excellence, and a proactive mindset.Responsibilities and Impact:Serve as a subject matter expert for S&P Global's DDI service, offering second and third-line support to address complex issues.Collaborate closely with product architects and engineering teams to drive the achievement of our business goals through the identification and prioritization of key initiatives.Design and implement global DDI solutions across data centre, cloud, campus environments and the internet.Contribute to and/or develop and implement automated DDI solutions to enhance efficiency, streamline processes, and ensure seamless adaptability to evolving technological landscapes.Collaborate with product owners to develop and lead initiatives to evaluate the applicability and fit of new technologies and approaches, as well as defining the standards and best-practices for their use within S&P Global.What We’re Looking For:Basic Required Qualifications:5+ years’ of Senior Engineer level of experience using Infoblox or an equivalent system that integrates DNS, DHCP and IP Address Management services; experience of Microsoft AD DNS, ISC Bind and DHCP and experience of Internet DNS services including domain registration, domain registrar activities and DNS hostingExpert level knowledge is required and must include the ability to configure and troubleshoot the DDI systems and the DDI protocols - DNS, DHCP, IPAM and NTP - at all levels (high level down to network level packet captures).General IT operation experience and understanding; experience of Linux command line and scripting including Python, experience with API coding, internet CDNs, experience designing, building and supporting IP networking.  Experience of DDI data migration between platforms, for example, AD DNS to DDI system or DDI system to DDI system, planning and implementing large scale transformation would be advantageous. Experience of Cloud DNS offerings and integration of DDI products with multiple cloud services.Soft skills:Delivery focused with an attention to detail.Must be able to effectively handle multiple projects simultaneously.Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Additional Preferred Qualifications:Network automation experience is preferred especially experience designing, developing, and deploying, Python- based solutions following software development best practices.Return to Work: Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.What’s In It For You?Our Purpose:Progress is not a self-starter. Job ID: 296121
Posted On: 2024-01-30
Location: Hyderabad, Telangana, India

About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):11Title: Senior AnalystThe Team:
When you join S&P Global Ratings, you join one of the world's leading providers of independent credit risk research and benchmarks. You are part of a team that produces high quality fundamental research based on established criteria, you have the opportunity to ask probing questions to senior corporate executives, and interact with the global investor community.

The Impact:At S&P Global Ratings, your analytical opinion truly matters and each person who works here has an essential role in S&P Global Ratings reputation of integrity, transparency, and ratings excellence.S&P Global Ratings plays a vital role in bringing transparency and comparability to the financial markets and helps investors and others measure and manage credit risk.By supporting capital markets, S&P Global Ratings helps people to start and grow businesses, cities and states to build highways and hospitals, and manufacturers to build factories and create jobs.With offices in 26 countries, rating $47.5 trillion in debt, and with nearly 1,400 credit analysts, S&P Global Ratings is an important part of the world’s financial infrastructure and has played a leading role for more than 150 years in providing investors and financers the information they need to more easily, quickly and efficiently provide capital to businesses and governments.
What’s in it for you:We prepare our most successful Senior Analysts and Associate Directors to become our future senior analysts that act as spokespersons and senior analytical leaders in sector teams. A high performing Associate/Associate Director is likely to be considered for rating more complex and higher profile issuers, as well as for investor outreach.Build a career with a global companyGrow and improve your skills by working on research and analysis with global impact
Responsibilities:Perform rigorous analytical research, fundamental credit analysis, analysis of financial statements, building of financial models and forecasts, and writing of analytical reports on rated corporate entitiesMaintain direct analytical responsibility for a portfolio of rated corporate issuers with the guidance of a Senior AnalystOngoing surveillance and rating recommendationsRepeat analytical contact with rated entities’ senior management, and presentation of analytical findings to internal and external constituencies
What We’re Looking For:
Basic Qualifications:Master’s degree in Business Administration, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Engineering, MathematicsTwo or more years of credit, analytical, or related financial services experience either at S&P Global Ratings or externally.Strong analytical skills with a deep understanding of financial statement analysis and accounting concepts.Proficiency with figures and the ability to maintain accuracy and be detail oriented while complying with deadlines.Strong Excel/Word/PowerPoint and database application skills.Ability to prepare forecasts based upon reasoned assumptions.Solid communication skills, verbal and written, as well as the capacity to expand, learn, and make a contribution.Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $85,700 to $170,400. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location.In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits, we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.About S&P Global Ratings
At S&P Global Ratings, our analyst-driven credit ratings, research, and sustainable finance opinions provide critical insights that are essential to translating complexity into clarity so market participants can uncover opportunities and make decisions with conviction. By bringing transparency to the market through high-quality independent opinions on creditworthiness, we enable growth across a wide variety of organizations, including businesses, governments, and institutions.S&P Global Ratings is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI).  S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today.

Job ID: 296859
Posted On: 2024-01-30
Location: New York, New York, United States

jobtitle: Rating Analyst OR Research Assistant  - Financial Institutions (Korea  Team)
job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):09The Team:You will be part of a global and multicultural team, and you will play a key role for analyzing financial institutions in Korea. Our team follows up with Korean financial market developments and client-specific issues timely, and we incorporate these into various research reports and rating reviews.The Impact:You will be responsible for the development of spreadsheet statistics and databases and will be actively involved in developing rating committee presentations, portfolio reviews and commentaries. You will proactively assist not only the analysis of individual company’s financial performance, competitive industry placement, and quality of management, but also the vigorous analysis on Korean macroeconomy along with regional/global economic trends.What you stand to Gain: You will build up strong research skills for the collection, collation, interpretation, and maintenance of data for analytical purposes. You will also develop good communication skills by rating committee participation and meetings with various stakeholders including clients, investor, and regulators. You also enhance writing skills by supporting analysts for various research publications. Your sphere of knowledge on macroeconomy and financial sector will also expand by close coordination with our regional and global FI teams.Responsibilities:• Collects economic and financial information specific to financial market players in Korea and leverages broad scope of knowledge when performing analysis on data sets• Focuses on theory and concepts, applying quantitative or analytical skills to complete projects/studies/tasks• Works collaboratively with other individuals and teams to ensure accuracy and timeliness of information to clients• Conducts research including identifying data, data input, and statistical analysis of results and creates and maintains data and analysis reports• Prepares presentations and engages directly with clients to present analysis• Works closely with senior analysts to ensure the quality of data and researchWhat We’re Looking For:• Bachelor degree in finance, economics, accounting or related subjects. Pursuing CPA or CFA designation plus.• Proficiency in Korean is very strongly preferred.• An S&P employee at this level would typically have 1-3 years of research or analytical experience with financial institutions.• Strong Excel skills and ability to collate and analyse information, as well as good organization skill and high attention to detail• Good time management and prioritization; manage competing priorities while maintaining high quality standards; and to work in a team.• Be able to effectively communicate (verbal, written, presentation)About S&P Global Ratings

Job ID: 297331
Posted On: 2024-01-30
Location: Central, Hong Kong

jobtitle: Director, Market Outreach Relationship Manager, Pacific Region
job description:
About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):13The Role: Director - Market Outreach Relationship Manager, Pacific RegionThe Team:You will be joining a diverse, professional, and well-regarded team called Market Outreach which is part of the Commercial organization at S&P Global Ratings. Our team culture is inclusive and flexible, with expectations of high performance, innovation, and accountability. The team is accountable for strengthening S&P Global Ratings investor franchise and gaining investor advocacy. The Market Outreach team has a variety of background experience in capital markets, including top asset managers and investment banks, creating a rich base of resource and knowledge.The Impact:You will plan and execute the analytical outreach activities serving needs of senior fixed income investors in Australia and New Zealand with an aim of strengthening S&P Global Ratings’ franchise with them and generate their advocacy. You will also share market insights gained in the investor interactions with the analytical team to help them plan their activities and research.What you stand to Gain: You will get to establish relationships with senior fixed income investors in Australia and New Zealand and understand their needs and market dynamics. You will get to craft/inform business solutions for the regional market in collaboration with Commercial teams of S&P Global Ratings as well as with other S&P Global divisions in the region. You will also develop a keen understanding of entity and sector fundamentals while working alongside analytical team to deliver outreach and hear market views. Given the needs of the role, you will have the opportunity to hone your influencing and communications skills. The role will also have some regional and global responsibilities providing you a global vantage point.Responsibilities:Accountable for the development and execution on an outreach strategy for an identified portfolio of investors and key influencers with the aim of winning investor advocacy.Provides tangible actionable feedback to the commercial team around innovation, product development and engagement opportunities from market interactions.Represents the ‘first line’ of engagement with the market in relation to analytical, research and criteria matters and facilitates effective interaction between the market and the analytical teams.Interacts, on an ongoing basis, with the analytical, country and commercial teams to ensure the effectiveness of the role and the co-ordination of activity such as meetings with investors.Gathers and curates investor feedback and needs to inform analytical team’s outreach and research pipeline.In collaboration with analytical team, develops an outreach program targeted to achieve maximum impact with identified key investors and other stakeholders (one-to-one meetings, Roundtables, small events, etc.)Acts upon market intelligence received as appropriate such as tracking commercial opportunity, feeding back criteria comments or facilitating analytical education etc. and elevates strategic matters for consideration of senior management.Contributes to the achievement of an annual and three-year market outreach plan both individually and for the group.Collaborates across various functions within S&P Global Ratings and across S&P Global divisions by sharing relevant insights gained and opportunities sighted.Makes recommendations as to the ongoing development of the stakeholder portfolio for which they are responsible including additions/removals from the portfolio etc.Provide local planning support to Marketing Events team (who do not have a representative in the Pacific region) for in-person events in the region.Enhance the reputation of S&P Global Ratings and S&P Global through ensuring professional proactive engagement with the market which will beneficially impact our external stakeholders’ view of the value we add to the global ratings market.What We’re Looking For:Has strong knowledge of the fixed income market in the Pacific region as well as an understanding of various prevalent asset classes and the factors driving their issuance and pricing.Good knowledge of Asia-Pacific cross-border fixed income market will be a plus.An understanding of S&P Global Ratings business and products.Strong interpersonal and communication skills and the ability to connect and communicate with all (commercial and analytical, as appropriate) levels internally within an organization as well as externally at a senior level.Can manage workload across multiple projects simultaneously and be able to work independently.Understanding of regulatory requirements and ability to adapt to global environment.Has working knowledge of relevant analytical criteria including ratings, green evaluations, ESG etc.Familiarity with CRM tools.Excellent English language skills to facilitate more effective market interaction.#LI-KM1#LI-EY1About S&P Global Ratings

Job ID: 296399

Location: Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

About the Role:Grade Level (for internal use):07Department overviewS&P Global's Market Intelligence Group empowers a diverse spectrum of private equity and venture capital firms to control their data more effectively and drive internal analytics and insights. Whether it is for portfolio analytics, valuations, investor reporting, or on-demand insight into operating metrics of a specific asset, this team is at the forefront of the FinTech space. Position summary Within the Data, Valuation and Analytics (DVA) division, the Valuation Services team is looking for an analyst to deliver valuation services and support to a roster of marquee Venture Capital/Private Equity clients spread across the US and APAC regions. The analyst will be working on ASC 820 valuations for fair value reporting, as well as 409a valuations for tax reporting purposes.
Duties & accountabilitiesGather and review underlying source data for the purpose of completing valuations of privately- held companies.Perform portfolio valuations for VC/PE funds, and business valuations of early-stage venture-backed companies with complex capital structure and illiquid classes of stock.Work with the Valuation team to complete valuations reports that adhere to all AICPA standards pertaining to Fair ValueAssist the Implementation team with interpretation of financial and legal documents used for onboarding clients to the platform.Assist the Client Support Manager with client request resolution.Contribute to the design and enhancement of the proprietary models and software platforms used to perform valuations.
Education and ExperiencePost-Graduation in Finance/Accounting - MBA/PGDBM from an accredited college or university is strongly preferred. CFA/CPA or any of the levels cleared therein would be an advantage.Strong understanding and hands on experience of various business valuation methodsPrior 409A /ASC 820 valuation experience a plusA flair for mathematical techniques and an analytical background. Knowledge of quantitative models like Black-Scholes OPMA basic understanding of the Venture Capital and Private Equity spaceStrong proficiency in Microsoft Excel and a conceptual understanding of the SaaS business model
Personal competenciesExcellent verbal and written communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsThe ability to work in an efficient and responsible manner.  Extreme attention to detail and an ability to document processes.Experience of working effectively with others in a team setting while under the pressure of deadlinesWillingness to work long hours at critical times (i.e., quarterly reporting) based on need.Positive attitude, exceptional drive and staminaIntellectual curiosity and inquisitivenessShift Timings - 10: 30 AM to 7: 30 PMAbout S&P Global Market Intelligence
